name: inartistic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not good at creating or understanding art: However artistic or inartistic you are, you cannot walk into this space without feeling absolutely astonished. To the careless or inartistic eye, the city is hard, angular, and ugly.
not skilfully or attractively made: We passed through several rooms, all of which were rather plain and inartistic. I was struck by the novel's somewhat inartistic language.
More examplesFewer examplesEvents brought him nearer to London, and further from his dull, inartistic life. The paper covers of the books are usually inartistic and even ugly.
